definition: (derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice

sentences.chinese: “頭目”同樣還會需要一名“軍師”。

sentences.english: He is a member of the Board and adviser to the president.
sentences.chinese: 他現在是董事會成員，而且是主席的軍師。

sentences.english: To, the military adviser just broke up with you, go to dry what?
sentences.chinese: 對了，軍師剛剛和你們分手，去幹什麼了？

sentences.english: The force contained 39 divisions, 20 of these were American.
sentences.chinese: 作戰部隊一共有39個師，其中20個是美軍師。

sentences.english: Marshal is killed counsellor and time will, unfortunate by another quiver of attack by a hidden enemy.
sentences.chinese: 元帥殺死軍師和番將，不幸被另一番將暗箭射中。

sentences.english: I had orders from the director general to take this city.
sentences.chinese: 吾奉軍師將令，已取城了。

sentences.english: Military councilor Wu Ying sent Shi Qian to attend to this matter.
sentences.chinese: 軍師吳用派施七俺出席這個問題。

sentences.english: Arms of division of the iron army-invincible army in maneuver defeats accipitral hill, exposed 8 big questions.
sentences.chinese: 演習中鐵軍師兵敗鷹山，暴露了八大問題。

definition: Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
